{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423217,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-12T23:55:16.346Z","cooked":"

So our team wants to get a battery analyzer to get more information about our batteries and our school is giving us some money we need to spend before the end of the fiscal year. However it has to be from local sources (Amazon counts as local though) and we were wondering if there was a suitable analyzer we can get through amazon.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-12T23:55:16.346Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":41,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":265.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/1","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3423228,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T00:15:39.452Z","cooked":"

The SkyRC BD250 or BD350 is probably your best bet. I haven’t personally used either one.

Computerized Battery Analyzer Electrical
Hi guys, I was wondering if you know another battery analyzer like this: https://www.andymark.com/products/computerized-battery-analyzer that does the same job just cheaper? If you may know another way to check your battery it will also be very helpful!

With enough resistors, determination and Jank…

image1347×431 64.7 KB

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T03:09:35.550Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":93.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Mike","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"620 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/4","custom_user_title":"620 Software Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423275,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T03:49:50.455Z","cooked":"

Just a note, from a conversation we had on the other linked thread, the BD350 apparently does not work standalone but only with the T1000 charger. The BD380 appears to work standalone but doesn’t explicitly list support for lead-acid batteries in its manual (though it’s likely it would work).

If you want a known quantity the BD250 is known to work well and is a good value.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T03:49:50.455Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":94.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":10647,"username":"AllenGregoryIV","name":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/5","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423419,"name":"Ada T","username":"cmdada","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T19:29:31.501Z","cooked":"

we legitimately did this with great results for battery categorization

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T19:29:31.501Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Ada T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28768,"username":"Mike_RT","name":"Mike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_rt/{size}/186553_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/6","custom_user_title":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423432,"name":"Mike","username":"Mike_RT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_rt/{size}/186553_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T20:08:33.178Z","cooked":"

I am not joking :D. We are currently building out a battery test rig similar to the one made by The Charge End goal is to start with utilizing as many old FRC parts as possible to keep the price low. IE for driving the load we are just running old spark motor controllers and for right now current measurement via a PDP (although this is suboptimal). Think we will move to using a current shunt and a [INA219] to measure the current.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T20:08:33.178Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":146,"readers_count":145,"score":49.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Mike","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://the-charge.com/uploads/3/5/3/0/35304458/testing_and_analysis_of_first_robotics_batteries__2018_.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":18}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60586,"username":"cmdada","name":"Ada T","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"620 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/7","custom_user_title":"620 Software Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424209,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T16:45:14.110Z","cooked":"

I can’t resist posting my pile-o-resistors in my 50 Amp tester…

I’ve used this bare board tester. Its easier to use than the BD250, IMHO.

And the BD250:

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T16:45:14.110Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424239,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T18:19:03.248Z","cooked":"

I swear we’re the same guy in different parallel universes or something…

I’ve got a pile of those same resistors for just this sort of project but my intent was to use a high power FET for each one and use an existing current log from matches or practice runs to replicate loads from actual games.

Too many projects backing up over here so it dropped in priority.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T18:19:03.248Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":32.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Chris Herzog","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40142,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/9","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424242,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T18:36:36.433Z","cooked":"


I just used switches on the front panel; it was complicated enough already!
You really do need a honkin’ heat sink and fan to get rid of 600 Watts!
My fan is AC powered, so it keeps running after the battery test shuts off.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T18:36:36.433Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424277,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T20:21:41.884Z","cooked":"

That looks way too clean.

On a related note, here’s how you turn a 200W resistor into a 1200W resistor.

20240914_1549211920×2560 290 KB

If you’re wondering, yes, the water gets warm. Makes sense… 1200 watts.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T20:23:20.872Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":74.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471164,"topic_slug":"alternate-battery-analyzer","display_username":"Mark Wasserman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-battery-analyzer/471164/11","custom_user_title":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424284,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T20:47:58.811Z","cooked":"

It looked a lot less clean once it had wires on it
Though I did give in to the urge to get out the lacing tape and fancy it up a bit! As part of digging around for a replicatable 50 Amp tester I found that you can get 12 Volt water heater elements pretty cheaply, but folks found the idea of potentially boiling water a bit nerve wracking. I found some PTC car heaters that work…

image576×768 92.4 KB
